14:06 <sburjan> Hello devs. I am trying to release an application because mvn release:perform fails with the following  
14:06 <sburjan>   [INFO] --- maven-enforcer-plugin:1.1:enforce (enforce-java) @ application-task ---  
14:06 <sburjan>     You must release with Java 6!  
14:07 <sburjan> but java -version states I have Java 6  
14:10 <tmortagne> sburjan: are you really sure maven is executed with the default java ?  
14:11 <tmortagne> use mvn -version  
14:11 <sburjan> tmortagne: indeed, mvn uses version 7. How can I change it ?  
14:12 <tmortagne> maven itself does not force using java7, you have something in front of maven itself that set java 7 as the current Java  
14:12 <tmortagne> I guess mvn lead to a script in your case  
14:12 <tmortagne> look at this script  
14:13 <tmortagne> or maybe you standard java is java6 but you have your JAVA\_HOME in your env vars pointing to java7  
14:14 <tmortagne> sburjan: this variable is not set by default for me so I can't really tell you what is wrong for you  
14:14 <sburjan> tmortagne: I don;t have it set either  
14:15 <tmortagne> sburjan: something set java7 as the current java before maven is executed somewhere  
14:15 <tmortagne> the only sure that is sure is that it's not done by Maven itself  
14:16 <tmortagne> so you did it or something you used did it  
14:17 <sburjan> tmortagne: it's odd because I have no scripts, I just lunch mvn exect fomr the downloaded maven  
14:18 <tmortagne> sburjan: that mvn itself is a script  
14:19 <tmortagne> look at what it's doing  
14:19 <tmortagne> maybe you will find how it end up with java7  
14:20 <tmortagne> maybe you set MAVEN\_OPTS or $HOME/.mavenrc  
14:26 <sburjan> tmortagne: I have release task application version 2.1, could you promote it please on Nexus ?  
14:27 <tmortagne> sburjan: done  
14:27 <tmortagne> don't forget to release it on jira  
14:28 <sburjan> tmortagne: done http://jira.xwiki.org/plugins/servlet/project-config/TASKMAN/versions  
14:30 <sburjan> tmortagne: from the http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Task+Manager+Application I have clicked the refresh button, but version 2.1 does not show up. What am I missing?  
14:37 <tmortagne> sburjan: no idea what is wrong  
14:38 <sburjan> tmortagne, doesn't update to 2.1 even if the artefact is already on maven. My wiki doesn't see version 2.1  
14:39 <tmortagne> sburjan: what do you mean by "your wiki exactly" if you use simple search it only looks at extension.xwiki.org  
14:39 <sburjan> tmortagne: ok, then that'snmormal, since extensions doesn't see version 2.1  
14:39 <tmortagne> it's not going to see something that does not exist  
14:39 <tmortagne> use advanced search  
14:40 <sburjan> yes, but my issue is the extensions not being able to see version 2.1  
14:40 <tmortagne> yes I can see that  
14:41 <tmortagne> there is no error in the log  
14:42 <tmortagne> I have no idea why extensions.xwiki.org does not see it  
14:42 <tmortagne> looking through nexus  
14:42 <tmortagne> it's properly listed on http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/xwiki/contrib/application-task/maven-metadata.xml  
14:43 <cjd> has quit  
14:43 <tmortagne> and given the log on IRC looks like the updater is called at least  
14:44 <tmortagne> I updated a bunch of extension this morning and it wokered well  
14:44 <tmortagne> worked  
14:45 <sburjan> tmortagne: yes, I saw  
14:45 <tmortagne> will have to try to reproduce it locally  
14:58 <cjd> has joined #xwiki

15:23 <tmortagne> sburjan: and of course I can't reproduce the issue locally (2.1 imported without any issue), otherwise it would not be fun...  
15:24 <sburjan> tmortagne: :(  
15:25 <tmortagne> there is really weird things on xwiki.org  
15:25 <tmortagne> there is still the bug where the extension page is saved without any modification that I was not able to reproduce whatever the way I tried  
15:25 <tmortagne> looks like I will have to debug xwiki.org directly or something

17:06 <vmassol1> anyone remembers a script service method having an enum (I'm testing something)?  
17:06 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
17:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: org.xwiki.logging.script.LoggingScriptService  
17:10 <vmassol> thanks  
17:14 <vmassol> tmortagne: if I wish to have the DW starts again, what do I need to modify in status.xml?  
17:14 <vmassol> at the end: <state>COMPLETED</state>  
17:14 <tmortagne> you can just delete it  
17:14 <vmassol> the whole file?  
17:14 <tmortagne> yep  
17:14 <vmassol> ok  
17:14 <tmortagne> it's not a big deal
